Class PhysicsMotor

  • java.lang.Object
    • hevs.gdx2d.components.physics.PhysicsMotor

  • public class PhysicsMotor
extends java.lang.Object
    A motor to make two objects turn around each other.

    1.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • PhysicsMotor

        public PhysicsMotor(Body body1,
            Body body2,
            Vector2 anchorPoint,
            float motorSpeed,
            float maxMotorTorque,
            boolean motorEnable)
        Constructor which defines and creates the RevoluteJoint. It also sets the desired information for the PhysicsMotor.
        Parameters:
        body1 - The first body for the joint
        body2 - The second body for the joint
        anchorPoint - The point that links the two objects
        motorSpeed - The speed of the motor
        maxMotorTorque - The maximum torque that the motor can exert
        motorEnable - If the motor is enabled or not

      • PhysicsMotor

        public PhysicsMotor(Body body1,
            Body body2,
            Vector2 anchorPoint)
        Another constructor which defines and creates the RevoluteJoint. It also sets all information for the PhysicsMotor to 0 and false. See PhysicsMotor(Body, Body, Vector2, float, float, boolean)
        Parameters:
        body1 - The first body for the joint
        body2 - The second body for the joint
        anchorPoint - The point that links the two objects

      • initializeMotor

        public void initializeMotor(float speed,
                   float torque,
                   boolean enable)
        Initialize the motor with the desired parameters. This is applicable for every instance of PhysicsMotor.
        Parameters:
        speed - The new speed for the joint motor
        torque - The new torque value for the joint motor
        enable - The new state for the joint motor
